Comment: Another game versus one of my co-workers, Ian.  I begin with my usual e4!
I have recently began to like this move more and more.  It feels strong in the center.
I have recently began to like this move more and more.  It feels strong in the center.
I have never been a big fan of the N on the edge of the board.
here is why the N should never be allowed on h6.  Now the king side pawn structure is ruined and there's doubled pawns on the H-file.

I had to make a tough decision here, I didn't want to block my N and my light bishop, but I didn't like the exchange problem imposed by his B on g7.

they always say take with the piece worth less.  this move allows me to advance my N, as opposed to if he had taken with the pawn I would've been stuck.
